DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate effect non-invasive Er : YAG thermal laser therapy treat female stress mixed urinary incontinence .
DOC.brief_title: Er : YAG Laser Treatment Female Stress Mixed Urinary Incontinence ( IncontiLase )
DOC.detailed_description: Urinary incontinence ( UI ) common disorder affect woman various age impact aspect life . Therapeutic approach range conservative therapy , heavily dependent patient compliance , different , invasive , surgical procedure . The aim study evaluate non-invasive erbium : yttrium-aluminum-garnet ( Er : YAG ) laser treatment ( IncontiLase ) potential treatment strategy stress UI ( SUI ) mix UI ( MUI ) . The treatment work thermally affecting vaginal mucosa , emphasis anterior vaginal wall , result partial denaturation collagen fibres stimulation new collagen formation , lead firm support urethra improvement incontinence symptom . The investigator include 175 woman newly diagnose SUI ( 66 % woman ) MUI ( 34 % ) , respectively perform average 2.5±0.5 procedure woman separate two-month period , use Er : YAG laser . Patients clinically examine classified incontinence type ( SUI MUI ) grade ( mild , moderate , severe severe ) use International Consultation Incontinence Modular Questionnaire ( ICIQ ) assess Incontinence Severity Index ( ISI ) : ISI therapy 5.7±2.1 point . Treatment discomfort measure every session visual analogue system pain scale , adverse effect patient ' satisfaction follow . Follow-ups perform two , six twelve month treatment .
DOC.criteria: clinically confirm UI normal PAP smear ( Papanicolaou cytology ) negative urine culture integrity vaginal mucosa ( without injury bleed ) pregnancy intake photosensitive drug vaginal injury vaginal bleed infection treat area clinical diagnosis pure urge urinary incontinence
